body_html:
Described how to compile PyTorch 4.0 under Ubuntu 17.10 + CUDA 9.0 in this blog post.

Same issue, Ubuntu 17.10, CUDA 9.0.
I've tried compiling with gcc versions 6.4.0, 5.4.1 and 4.8.5.

With 5.4.1 I get the error mentioned above:

pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half.h:42:12: error: ‘to_string’ is not a member of ‘std’

With 4.8.5 I've tried the _GLIBCXX_USE_C99 trick, but then it fails with:

python/pytorch/aten/src/TH/THAtomic.c:9:23: fatal error: stdatomic.h: No such file or directory

stdatomic.h missing seems to be a known bug in 4.8 without any workaround. I've tried downloading the header from gcc sources, but then it just crashes with more errors.

Edit: got it to work with gcc 4.8.5 + placing specific version of stdatomic.h into pytorch/aten/src/TH

body:
Described how to compile PyTorch 4.0 under Ubuntu 17.10 + CUDA 9.0 in this [blog post](https://medium.com/@Inoryy/compiling-pytorch-4-0-on-ubuntu-17-10-with-cuda-9-0-and-python-3-6-6769a0df56d5).

---

Same issue, Ubuntu 17.10, CUDA 9.0.  
I've tried compiling with gcc versions `6.4.0`, `5.4.1` and `4.8.5`.

With `5.4.1` I get the error mentioned above:
> pytorch/aten/src/ATen/Half.h:42:12: error: ‘to_string’ is not a member of ‘std’

With `4.8.5` I've tried the `_GLIBCXX_USE_C99` trick, but then it fails with:
> python/pytorch/aten/src/TH/THAtomic.c:9:23: fatal error: stdatomic.h: No such file or directory

`stdatomic.h` missing seems to be a known bug in `4.8` without any workaround. I've tried downloading the header from [gcc sources](https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/blob/aedd2947e223fda8838a2d2d9e7a4dc9327d8855/gcc/ginclude/stdatomic.h), but then it just crashes with more errors.

**Edit**: got it to work with gcc `4.8.5` + placing specific version of [stdatomic.h](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/0fadac62abe1f559def14f01391670980b3316b8/gcc/ginclude/stdatomic.h) into `pytorch/aten/src/TH`
